articles.title: What Happens When A Black Hole 'Spaghettifies' A Star? First-Of-Its-Kind Study Gives Answers - ABP Live
articles.description: A Sun-like star was tidally disrupted by a black hole which is one million times more massive than the star. This called 'spaghettification'. It took place 215 million light years from Earth.
